newsitem.title: FRANCE: HORSE RACING-PEINTRE CELEBRE BIDS FOR DOUBLE.
newsitem.headline: HORSE RACING-PEINTRE CELEBRE BIDS FOR DOUBLE.

text.p: The spotlight will be firmly on impressive French Derby winner Peintre Celebre as he bids to land a Group One double in the Grand Prix de Paris at Longchamp on Sunday.
Connections of Peintre Celebre have opted to run the high class colt in this 10 furlong race instead of the Irish Derby. He will run with the aid of a pacemaker, Super Cub.
The son of Nureyev is dropping back in distance for the big Parisian event as he reverts to a mile and a quarter.
However, his class should more than compensate, and on form has little to fear from the French Derby fifth and sixth, Ithaki and Shaka.
Both horses were well held at Chantilly, although the Group One Criterium de Saint-Cloud and Group Two Prix Hocquart winner Shaka is undoutebly capable of better.
Shaka, from the yard that won this race in 1994 with Millkom, is expected to play a more active role here and should be suited by the drop back in distance.

Alekos, third in the Prix Hocquart, and Zenith Rose, second in a low key edition of the Group One Prix Lupin, complete the home line up. Alekos is the most appealing of the pair and has an outside chance.
English interests will be represented by Royal Amaretto from the ambitious Brian Meehan yard.
Soft ground specialist Royal Amaretto had a poor run in the Irish 2,000 Guineas and is a place prospect at best.
